sections.heading: Kubernetes Ingress
sections.content: Ingress manages external access to services in a cluster. It provides HTTP and HTTPS routing, SSL termination, and name-based virtual hosting. Requires an Ingress Controller to function.

sections.heading: Streamlit Deployment - Deployment
sections.content: Deploy Streamlit apps using Streamlit Community Cloud, Heroku, Docker, or cloud platforms. Set up secrets management, configure requirements.txt, and use streamlit run app.py to launch your application.

sections.heading: Kubernetes Pods - Container Management
sections.content: A Pod is the smallest deployable unit in Kubernetes. It represents a single instance of a running process and can contain one or more containers. Pods share storage and network resources within the same node.

sections.heading: Kubernetes Deployments - Application Management
sections.content: Deployments manage ReplicaSets and provide declarative updates to Pods. They ensure desired number of replicas are running and handle rolling updates, rollbacks, and scaling operations seamlessly.
